windowsVersions.description: Windows 95 introduced the Start menu, taskbar, and focused on multitasking and user-friendly interfaces.
Windows XP combined stability and efficiency with a more refined and user-friendly interface.
Windows Vista introduced a new visual style and enhanced security features, but was criticized for its performance and compatibility issues.
Windows 7 was a major improvement over Vista, focusing on performance enhancements and usability.
Windows 8 introduced a new Start screen with live tiles and was optimized for touchscreens.
Windows 10 brought back the Start menu and introduced a unified platform for PCs, tablets, and phones.
Windows 11 introduced a new design, improved performance, and enhanced support for virtual desktops and gaming.
